title: What 'Public Ivy' colleges offer associate degrees after high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: The original set of “public Ivy” colleges and universities included eight institutions, to match the eight Ivy League members: College of William and MaryMiami University (of Ohio)University of California (all campuses)University of MichiganUniversity of North CarolinaUniversity of Texas, AustinUniversity of VermontUniversity of VirginiaThe original list was assembled in 1985 and has seen other additions since then. I do not think any of the original “public Ivy” institutions offer associate degree programs. However, a review of their web sites should provide a definite answer.
